The basic salaries at Google are considered to be low compared to industry standards. For instance, [[system administrator]]s earn no more than $33,000–37,000: this is considered to be low by [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]] standard levels.
+
The basic salaries at Google are considered to be low compared to industry standards. For instance, [[system administrator]]s earn no more than $33,000–37,000: this is considered to be low by [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]] standard levels.
  +   +
However, despite the low salaries, Google's strong brand and stellar prospects (relative to most Bay Area companies) continue to attract far more applicants than there are positions available. As a result, Google reportedly had to hire one in-house legal recruiter just to help the legal department sort through resumes from job-hungry [[lawyer]]s.
  +   +
Also, Google's management is eager to avoid the fate of many [[dot-com]] companies who made poor hiring decisions without performing adequate [[due diligence]]. During [[2004]], job applicants for entry-level positions had to go through at least two written tests, three phone interviews, and three in-person interviews (including a meeting with Google's Board of Directors in certain cases).
